messageBody:
On Thu, 26 Jun 2003, Erik Ostermueller <erik.ostermueller@...>
wrote:

> You all need to let me know if I'm barking up the wrong mailing list
> for this.

user@... would probably have been better.

> I'm trying to get all my junit tests in a suite to run, even if
> there are one or more failures/errors. Afterwards, I want the build
> to fail if there were any failures or errors.

See the failureproperty and errorproperty attributes of <junit>.
Basically you set the halton* properties to false and use those
properties together with a conditional <fail> on the failureproperty
at the point where you want your build to fail.

From Ant's own build file (current CVS):

<junit printsummary="${junit.summary}" haltonfailure="${test.haltonfailure}"
filtertrace="${junit.filtertrace}"
fork="${junit.fork}"
failureproperty="tests.failed">
<BIG-SNIP/>
</junit>
<fail if="tests.failed">At least one test has failed.</fail>

Stefan
